instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-01700 no power
threads.message:
Arrived with coffee damage. Prior repair shop cleaned the board before arriving here so this one will suck. Currently stuck at 5v. CD3215 areas look spotless

pp3v3_g3h_rtx only 0.065v, no short

ppbus_g3h is shorted. Injected 1v but nothing was warm

What to check next ???

threads.title: 820-01700 no power
threads.message:
On T2 machines, PPBUS_G3H is the first voltage required.
Exact ohm value for the short?
Compare with the readings on all big coils; pay atention to CPU coils.
Remove CPU heatsink and use 20A lab PSU to inject voltage, if is close to pure short.

threads.title: 820-01700 no power
threads.message:
Diode mode for the short is 0.002.

How much voltage should be injected? Are you suggesting  lab PSU set to 20amps when injecting?

threads.title: 820-01700 no power
threads.message: PPBUS_HS_CPU caps are primarly what were affected by the spill. Can these affect PPBUS_G3H?

threads.title: 820-01700 no power
threads.message:
By the name, I would say are in the same PPBUS rail, don't you think?

When inject voltage, let ALWAYS lab PSU at max current limit.
And start injecting with 1V (sometime lower), increasing if needed.

threads.title: 820-01700 no power
threads.message:
Only component getting hot is the GPU. Im assuming this is to new to find a replacement GPU?

Is there a way to retrieve the data if the GPU was removed?

threads.title: 820-01700 no power
threads.message:
Ooops you've injected voltage assuming one of these caps is the culprit?
What if is one of the chips from GPU power supply?

Remove UA710-40 (one by one) and see if/when short disappears from PPBUS_G3H.

0.002 in diode mode could be a good reading; still a chance for GPU to be alive.

threads.title: 820-01700 no power
threads.message:
beautiful, short disappeared from PPBUS_G3H

Do you happen to know if these chips are available on similar donar boards or do they need to be  ordered separately??

threads.title: 820-01700 no power
threads.message: Check online with Mouser, if you don't have donor board.

threads.title: 820-01700 no power
threads.message: would  sic 635 work replacing sic 621??

threads.title: 820-01700 no power
threads.message: Have you had any luck finding these donar boards?

threads.title: 820-01700 no power
threads.message: Dificil to get T2 scrap boards; nothing yet on Aliexpress.

threads.title: 820-01700 no power
threads.message:
Replacement  UA710-40 arrived from digikey. Soldered and short is still gone but still no PPBUS 0v

What to check next??

threads.title: 820-01700 no power
threads.message: PPBUS_G3H 1.1V drops to .950 and goes back to 1.1V at F7000

threads.title: 820-01700 no power
threads.message:
ISL9240 MUST generate PPBUS_G3H by itself.
Post actual diode mode at F7000.

Remove F7000/1 and check R7060 voltage.
If still low, check all resistors and caps around U7000.
Post basic voltages, PIN, VDDA/P, AUX_DET_SMC_RST_IN, AUX_OK, A/BMON, CBC_ON, SMC_RST*.
You may need to change U7000...

threads.title: 820-01700 no power
threads.message:
.365 diode mode

vdda 0v  vddp 5v

AUX_DET .15v

amon  0v

bmon 0v

other voltages are under bga chips. Not sure how to measure those.

all voltages measured with F7000 F7001 removed

Is u7000 even available for purchase on this board?

threads.title: 820-01700 no power
threads.message: Do you get any voltage at R7020???

threads.title: 820-01700 no power
threads.message:
Problems on USB-C areas.
Check diode mode at R7020 first.

threads.title: 820-01700 no power
threads.message:
For some reason, CD3215 chips do not allow input voltage to arrive at R7020.
Check voltage and diode mode at LDO rails of all CD3215 chips.

threads.title: 820-01700 no power
threads.message:
PP1V5_UPC_TA_LDO_CORE 1.5V

PP1V5_UPC_TB_LDO_CORE 0V .489


PP1V5_UPC_XA_LDO_CORE 0V  .493

PP1V5_UPC_XB_LDO_CORE 0V  .493

threads.title: 820-01700 no power
threads.message:
Each chip has 3 more LDO rails.

When you check for voltage, connect charger to corresponding port.
Also test it in the both connection ways.

threads.title: 820-01700 no power
threads.message:
UB300

PP1V5_UPC_TA_LDO_CORE 1.5V
PP3V3_UPC_TA_LDO 3.4V

UB400

PP1V5_UPC_TB_LDO_CORE 1.5V .491
PP3V3_UPC_TB_LDO 3.4V  .490

U3100

PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO 3.4V .382
PP1V5_UPC_TA_LDO_CORE 1.5V .490

U3200

PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO 3.4V
PP1V5_UPC_TB_LDO_CORE 1.5V

I do not see any further LDO lines that go into the chips. Can you specify what other rails need to be measured???

threads.title: 820-01700 no power
threads.message:
UB3100

PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO 3.4V .382
PP1V5_UPC_TA_LDO_CORE 1.5V .490 

UB400

PP1V5_UPC_TB_LDO_CORE 1.5V
PP3V3_UPC_TB_LDO 3.4V

threads.title: 820-01700 no power
threads.message:
R7020 is 5v now

PPBUS_G3H still only 1v

threads.title: 820-01700 no power
threads.message: solved after replacing u7000

threads.title: 820-01700 no power
threads.message:
This recently came back for warranty and has the strangest issue. It will be stuck at 5v 0 amps but if measuring C7021 with the multi meter it will boot normally at 20v. As soon as the red probe is removed from C7021 it goes back to 5V 0 amps.

Any ideas how to fix this?

threads.title: 820-01700 no power
threads.message:
Check the real values of R7021/22.
Resolder any components related with CSIP/N lines of U7000.

You can also try removing C7021/22.
